title: Alan Judge (English footballer)
text:
Alan Graham Judge (born 14 May 1960) is a retired professional <a href="association%20football">football</a>er, who is the seventh oldest player to play in the <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a>. He played as a goalkeeper.
During his career he played for various clubs at all tiers of the League. He was part of the <a href="Oxford%20United%20F.C.">Oxford United</a> team that won the <a href="Football%20League%20Cup">Milk Cup</a> in 1986. He also briefly served as a backup goalkeeper for <a href="Chelsea%20F.C.">Chelsea</a> in the <a href="European%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">European Cup Winners' Cup</a>.
Often referred to as The Judge, after retiring from the professional game he worked as a driving instructor and goalkeeping coach at several clubs including Swindon and Oxford, occasionally acting as emergency goalkeeping cover. In 2001, he organised a re-run of the 1986 Milk Cup Final against <a href="Queens%20Park%20Rangers%20F.C.">QPR</a>, for charity.
On 18 March 2003, at the age of 42, he played his first Football League match since leaving <a href="Hereford%20United%20F.C.">Hereford United</a> in 1994. He helped Oxford to a 1–1 draw with <a href="Cambridge%20United%20F.C.">Cambridge United</a>, making a vital save in stoppage time. During the 2003–04 season he also made several appearances for <a href="Didcot%20Town%20F.C.">Didcot Town</a>. He made a second appearance for Oxford on 6 November 2004, at the age of 44 years and 176 days. This made him the seventh oldest footballer ever to have appeared in the <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a> or <a href="Premier%20League">Premier League</a>.
